events: Became interested in anatomy at early age
Started his career as a portrait painter
Studied anatomy and dissection in hospitals
Developed his remarkable skill in painting horses
Exhibited at the Society of Artists
Published his well-praised work 'The Anatomy of the Horse'
Experimented with various types of painting media such as enamel and earthenware
His work fell out of favour with onset of Romanticism
Continued painting despite his failing health
